item.title: Exploring Active Directory
item.description: 1. introduction Link to heading Active Directory (AD) is a tool for network administrators, enabling the creation and management of domains, users and objects within a corporate network. Through AD, it is possible to connect all machines to a DC (Domain Controler) server. to a DC (Domain Controler) server which authenticates users using the kerberos protocol. For example, an administrator can create a group of users within the corp.local domain and grant them specific privileges to access folders or internal systems.
